Execution of verclsid.exe with unusual c.Action: Monitor Windows Event ID 4688 (Process Creation) for verclsid.exe execution. Analyze command-line arguments for suspicious flags like /S /C. Identify the parent process. Use correlation analysis to identify instances where verclsid.exe is spawned by non-standard or unexpected parent processes (e.g., Office applications, scripts) and compare against historical baseline activity using descriptive statistics.

verclsid.exe spawning child processes or.Action: Monitor Windows Event ID 4688 for processes created by verclsid.exe. Monitor Zeek conn.log for outbound network connections initiated by verclsid.exe or its direct child processes. Use statistical analysis (e.g., frequency analysis, time series analysis) to identify rare or anomalous child process creation or network connection patterns compared to baseline activity.

Execution of verclsid.exe referencing an.Action: Monitor Windows Event ID 4688 for verclsid.exe execution. Extract the CLSID from the command line (/C {CLSID}). Maintain a baseline/list of commonly observed CLSIDs used by verclsid.exe in the environment using frequency analysis. Flag execution with CLSIDs not present in the baseline, or CLSIDs known to be associated with malicious activity.

Execution of verclsid.exe where the laun.Action: Monitor Windows Event ID 4688 for verclsid.exe execution. Extract the ParentProcessCommandLine. Analyze the parent command line for suspicious keywords, encoded commands, or patterns often seen in exploitation frameworks, scripts, or documents using string matching and regular expressions. Flag instances where the parent command line contains obfuscated strings or known malicious command patterns.
